1.text: Check the weather conditions to see if the water will freeze.

2.text: Boil a pot of tap water on the stovetop.

3.text: Hold the pot in both hands with oven mitts and carry it outside.

4.text: Toss your pot of water into the air to create instant snow.

5.text: Make a snowball if you can create enough snow.

6.text: Fill a large bowl with 3 cups (710 ml) of baking soda.

7.text: Pour 1⁄2 cup (120 ml) of hair conditioner on top of your baking soda.

8.text: Mix your ingredients with a large spoon to combine them.

9.text: Add glitter if you want to give your snow an extra shine.

10.text: Acquire the necessary components from a hardware store or online retailer.

11.text: Connect your pressure washer to the snow-making nozzle.

12.text: Attach the air hose from your compressor to the snow-making nozzle.

13.text: Secure your garden hose to the power washer and tighten it.

14.text: Turn on your air compressor then turn on your pressure washer.

15.text: Use your snow machine in the proper weather conditions.

16.text: Leave your machine on to allow snow to accumulate.
